title: Understanding Equilibrium
text: In a chemical equilibrium, the system is dynamic, meaning that reactions are still occurring, but at equal rates.

title: Reaction Rates at Equilibrium
text: Consider what happens to the rates of the forward and reverse reactions when a system reaches equilibrium.

title: Concentration Changes
text: At equilibrium, the concentrations of reactants and products do not change over time. This does not mean they are equal, but they remain constant.

hintAnswer: The forward and reverse reaction rates are equal, and the concentrations of reactants and products remain constant over time.
title: Identify the Correct Statement
text: Which statement best describes a system at equilibrium in analytical chemistry?
choices: All reactions have stopped and no further chemical change occurs.
The forward and reverse reaction rates are equal, and the concentrations of reactants and products remain constant over time.
Reactants have been fully converted to products.
The reaction mixture contains equal moles of reactants and products.
